ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to form a narrative with cinematic elements and how to create dynamic individual characters.
This course allowed me to develop my abilities in screenwriting to a considerable extent, and gave me the time to delve into my story in a satisfactory manner.
I learned how to critically analyze screenplays and how to write a full-length narrative. I also learned how to effectively give criticism and engage with the class on a discussion about their work.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course allows for good feedback, engaging interactions, and significant development. It would be difficult to improve.
I think the course was well-designed allowing people to be flexible in what they get done.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If anyone is inclined to become a screenwriter and is serious about making that happen, I would recommend the course.
If that student is interested in really working with and spending time on a screenplay, then I would recommend it.
I would certainly recommend this course to other students. The vibe of the course is relaxed and class discussion are often fun and helpful.
